column1: # Test Scenario: Check agent upgrade success and wmi table correct

column2: Apply to all devices, when we have at least 2 versions of release candidate. (version number: v1 < v2)

Press “Win + E” keys,
open File Explorer, go to the folder where “cmdextension.v1.msi and
cmdextension.v2.msi” locates
In file explorer, click on “File -> Open Windows PowerShell -> Open Windows PowerShell as administrator”

Wait 1 minute. 1. Check CMDExtension.log, there is "DeviceClient created and opened successfully"

2. Run Powershell in admin mode: $sc = Get-WmiObject -Namespace "root/cmd/clientagent" -Class SchedulerEntity; $test1=@();for ($i=0; $i -lt $sc.Length;$i++){$test1+=$sc[$i].PolicyId}; $test2=$test1 | select -unique; $test1.Length -eq $test2.Length

column3: The prompt window should pop up: Title is “Microsoft Cloud Managed Desktop Extension”, and Message is “Microsoft Cloud Managed Desktop Extension Setup completed successfully.”

column2:
Wait 1 minute. 1. Check CMDExtension.log, there is "DeviceClient created and opened successfully"

2. Run Powershell in admin mode: $sc = Get-WmiObject -Namespace "root/cmd/clientagent" -Class SchedulerEntity; $test1=@();for ($i=0; $i -lt $sc.Length;$i++){$test1+=$sc[$i].PolicyId}; $test2=$test1 | select -unique; $test1.Length -eq $test2.Length
Open “Control Panel -> Programs -> Uninstall a program”
column3: Verify “Microsoft Cloud Managed Desktop Extension” is present in the list of installed programs, and its Version is [v2-version-number].

column2:
Test Cleanup:


In the same powershell window as “Step 3”, run command: msiexec /x cmdextension.v2.msi
